qas.question: What plays a primary part in Catalan?
What plays a secondary part in Catalan?
How are vowel alternances in Catalan?

context: Like all the Romance languages, Catalan verbal inflection is <a0_0>more complex<a0_0/> than the nominal. <a1_0>Suffixation<a1_0/> is omnipresent, whereas <a2_0>morphological alternations<a2_0/> play a secondary role. Vowel alternances are <a3_0>active<a3_0/>, as well as infixation and suppletion. However, these are not as productive as in Spanish, and are mostly restricted to irregular verbs.
